12:54 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
13:36 <jonesmeier> has joined #xwiki  
13:37 <jonesmeier> hi, when using the video macro like this: {{video attachment="file.mp4"/}}  
13:38 <jonesmeier> i get a "Failed to execute the [html] macro": org.xwiki.rendering.macro.MacroExecutionException: When using the HTML macro inline, you can only use inline HTML content. Block HTML content (such as tables) cannot be displayed. Try leaving an empty line before and after the HTML macro.  
13:38 <jonesmeier> any idea what could be going wrong ?  
13:54 <evalica> jonesmeier: try adding some space before and after the macro  
13:55 <evalica> empty paragraphs  
14:04 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
14:23 <jonesmeier> evalica: ok thanks, i already tried that with just empty lines  
14:25 <jonesmeier> oh sorry, i forgot to mention: it works when using a YouTube URL, just not with the attachment  
14:25 <jonesmeier> in the examples on the macro page, the macro is used with a videoPoster attribute: {{video attachment="my-video.webm" videoPoster="poster.jpg"/}}  
14:25 <evalica> maybe you need to add the "attach:" prefix to the file name  
14:26 <jonesmeier> is this poster image necessary when using an attachment ?  
14:26 <jonesmeier> ok thanks i'll try that  
14:33 <jonesmeier> adding the "attach:" prefix did not work, i just got a "attachment not found" error, which was the same as when i used a random filename that really didn't exist  
14:33 <jonesmeier> so it seems the error with the HTML macro only appears if it's actually trying to render the player for the attachment  
14:38 <jonesmeier> thank you for the suggestions though  
14:46 <jonesmeier> adding the videoPoster attribute doesn't help  
14:49 <evalica> jonesmeier: not sure if you know how to do this, but you need to go in Macros/Video20?editor=object and in the 'Macro code' section, you need to have:             #if ($videoFormat != "")  
14:49 <evalica>             {{html clean='false'}}  
14:49 <evalica> I've added the "clean='false' " part  
14:50 <evalica> I will create an issue and report the bug  
14:57 <evalica> jonesmeier: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XVIDEO-8  
15:00 <evalica> jonesmeier: thanks for report  
15:04 <jonesmeier> evalica: thank you very much! i will see if i can edit the macro and fix it here aswell for the time being  
15:05 <evalica> k - good luck :)  
15:18 <jonesmeier> evalica: i managed to edit the macro, and it is working!  
15:19 <jonesmeier> still a little problem though, when i view the page in the WYSIWYG editor, the player is displayed flawlessly  
15:21 <jonesmeier> when i view the page outside of the editor though, it displays the video (clickable for start/stop), and what would be the controls undearneath it (play button, time etc.) is displayed as plain text, each object on a new line  
15:22 <jonesmeier> i have tried it in a current Firefox and MS Edge  
15:27 <evalica> jonesmeier: if you go to Macros/Video20 do you have the same problem? it might be that the attachment format has a strange player, or maybe you have some CSS that is interfering … or not sure. It is a problem for a clean instance? Since on my local instance I don't have the same issue.  
15:28 <evalica> I am testing on 8.2-RC1  
15:28 <evalica> if you can reproduce the problem on a clean instance, it should be reported …. but since I don't reproduce it, maybe it something that just you have?  
15:28 <evalica> a picture is worth 1000 words :P  
15:29 <jonesmeier> oh i didnt think of checking the example page, and yes i have the same problem there  
15:29 <jonesmeier> this is an XWiki Enterprise 6.1, so i should probably try updating that before i report it :)  
15:31 <jonesmeier> thanks again for looking into this, and promptly fixing it too!  
15:32 <evalica> jonesmeier: I see controls similar to this image http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Video+Macro/play-attachment.png if you see something different, an upgrade might help, but it could also be from some custom stylising you have  
15:32 <evalica> np - good luck  
15:32 <jonesmeier> i will see if updating the wiki resolves that last bit, and report back!  
15:32 <evalica> k  
15:33 <jonesmeier> yeah my player looked similar, its rendered correctly in the WYSIWYG
